title: Why do you ban Morgana?
body:
Yet another day where I can't play my one trick.   Sigh. 

Why do you ban Morgana? 

* What do you find most annoying or frustrating about her?
* Do you believe she has any counter play? 
* What champions do you play when you ban her, and how do you think she makes your life difficult?  
* Have you personally played Morgana or spent any serious time learning the champion?

I don't mean this to flame.  I'm honestly just curious to see what people say.  Keep in mind saying something like, "Lulz she too OP and busted" isn't really a good answer.   Although I'm sure some people will just copy and paste that lol.

I'm even willing to 1v1 anyone interested in learning how to play against Morgana.  Tell me a lane and a champion and we'll do a custom.  It might even be fun!

replies.body:
She has the best peel in the game and you cant counter it. Her black shield.
If the enemy doesnt do ap damage, then no matter how many stuns, slows and cc they throw at it, none of them stick.

So I ban morgana when I play supports that rely on cc, like leona
Do you think it is possible for Morgana to E everything all the time?

> [{quoted}](name=Morgana Deus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=U7Oryyyc,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2019-04-25T19:16:02.460+0000)
>
> Do you think it is possible for Morgana to E everything all the time?

No, but the best players dont have to e everything. Remember the threat of an ability is more dangerous than the use of the ability

I suppose that's fair.  Her E is a very interesting ability in my opinion.  

I find that the ADCs I play with in plat are incredibly bad at positioning.  They get hit by more skill shots than I can possibly E.   So in the end it doesn't even matter I have a CC blocking shield. 

Let's take Leona for example.  

Rank 1 Leona E is 12 seconds.   Morgana rank one E is 23 second CD.   So let's say you throw you E and I black shield.  Even if your E misses my black shield will be on CD for 11 seconds when your E comes off CD.  At this point you just all in Morgana or her ADC and you win.  

At higher levels of play people know this and people will fall back during blackshield's cooldown.   But this isn't an issue in iron/bronze/silver/gold and to an extent platinum.  You will see ADCs eat leona Es and thresh hooks on CD.  

So even as a person who has mained Morgana for thousands upon thousands of games I find leonas and threshes very frustrating to play against as a support.
usually beating morgana shield people hook a random person because good morgana e right before cc point and that is just too much for me to do playing against morgana
Fuck her spellshield, all spellshields are cheat.

simply when i play any sort of CC heavy support (namely {{champion:53}} {{champion:89}} and most importantly {{champion:555}} because the slowest of the slowest players who have 500 ping can react to his CC)

Pyke heavily dominates Morgana once he learns how to play.

You don't try to Q a shielded target... and you have plenty of time to redirect when you do. Not only that, his cooldown is MUCH lower than hers.

When I do Pyke (rarely because even though I can hyper carry, Pyke generally averages out in win rate), Just W up to Morg, Q her for the increased damage, and begin an auto attack sequence. If Morg tries to Q you, you use E to reposition. 

Morg will literally lose every time, unless you blew E going IN, rather than using W. Then she can R you and keep you locked down long enough.
She shuts down a huge number of champions, especially support just from her E and her Q is almost a guaranteed kill in lane, especially when partnered with an aggressive ADC.
Her Q isn't a free kill in lane.  Depends on the matchup.

Spell shield

/end thread
Do you also ban Malz and sivir and hate people who take cleanse or build banshees/edge of night?  I'm guessing you're an Eve or Ahri player?

> [{quoted}](name=Morgana Deus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=U7Oryyyc,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2019-04-25T21:30:47.349+0000)
>
> Do you also ban Malz and sivir and hate people who take cleanse or build banshees/edge of night?  I'm guessing you're an Eve or Ahri player?

Everything you just listed Ether has

A.  High cooldown once used (High being near 1 minute long at the very least)

Or

B. Only blocks 1 spell which can be played around by throwing your most useless spell first.

Does morg shield fits one of these? No.

It also doesn't matter if I play those two champs you listed, people will still ban her because her shield makes it hard to get a pick off of someone or shut someone down in teamfights. 

Heck, if you play these champions {{champion:53}} {{champion:555}} {{champion:412}}{{champion:89}}  and don't ban morg you're trolling.

Sivir's cooldown is not high and neither is Mal's. 

Spell Shield	COOLDOWN: 22 / 19 / 16 / 13 / 10 (Lower than Morgana's)

INNATE: Malzahar receives Void Shift if he hasn't taken damage nor been affected by Stun icon crowd control in the last 30 / 24 / 18 / 12 (based on level) seconds. Damage from Minion icon minions does not interact with Void Shift.

(and it scales with CDR)

Explain how these are at least 1 minute?

--------------

2) Thresh actually hard counters Morg. The problem is many Threshes do not know how to play their own champ.

3) Leona goes even. She can always all in on the person Morgana does not shield.

4) Pyke dominates Morgana when played correctly. You really are a bad Pyke if you lose this matchup.

> [{quoted}](name=Illabethe,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=U7Oryyyc,comment-id=0003000000000002,timestamp=2019-04-26T05:28:22.982+0000)
>
> Sivir's cooldown is not high and neither is Mal's. 


Did you miss the part where i said **EITHER** ?

If Sivr and Malz don't fall under the long cooldown then obviously it falls under

 "easily counterplayed by throwing another spell first" category  {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}} 

I'm not going to even bother with the rest, I already said it doesn't matter how the laning phase goes when the important thing is mid/late game.

I play Leona and never ban Morgana. She has too much CC in her kit to worry about a single target spell shield. Like seriously, just attack Morg if she shielded the ADC. She's not tanky. She'll die. Leona's R is also AoE, so it's not impossible to get both of them. Morgana is not a Leona counter. A nuisance, but not a counter.

Worst case scenario is the lane ends up a farm lane because Morgana decides to sit back, hold her Q and basically wait for you to make a bad engage. So... you don't. And then you end up more useful later in the game regardless.

And I'm pretty sure this is also true for Blitz and Thresh. Being semi-tanky front liners, they will be useful if they allow the lane to become passive. Pyke is the only one in that list that might need something to happen in the laning phase. And even then, I'm not sure Pyke would prefer to face a Leona/Blitz/Thresh over Morgana.

> [{quoted}](name=Ravenhale,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=U7Oryyyc,comment-id=0003000000000001,timestamp=2019-04-25T23:32:39.575+0000)

>  Like seriously, just attack Morg if she shielded the ADC. 

I'll remember that when it's mid/late game where the adc being alive is more important than the support morg, thanks for the tip.

No really /s
Mid/late, Leona is not diving the back line to let her ADC die to the enemy front line, mate.

Hard-counters almost every other support due to her ability to completely negate CC, which any good Morg will time almost flawlessly. 

Hell, she's even annoying mid for mages.

I dominate Morgana on Nami, Zyra. I'm sorry but, what you said can be purely mitigated by using minions.

She's annoying mid vs mages. She's vulnerable mid vs anyone else.

I don't think she's ban worthy in my low elo games. Half of the Morganas I play against don't know how to hold Q and she can only CC immune one person. As her root does not prevent an ADC from auto attacking, being hit by Q does not suddenly mean the ADC can't fight off the other ADC. She can be good to lock someone down during a gank, but ganks are so poorly coordinated that her potential is often wasted. I'm always surprised to see her banned, because she needs so much more help to be effective than other ban options.

Then again, I play Leona and Morgana more frequently than any other champs. Being so familiar with their weaknesses makes it difficult for me to understand why they would ever be banned.

I have a similar experience.  Generally when somebody pulls the rug out from under my feet and picks my Morgana I go something like Janna and just completely roll the lane.  Morgana is not that strong in the hands of an inexperienced player and a lot of people who pick her only do so because of bandwagon.

Even being my second highest played champion, I'm not very confident with my Morgana. We could be winning bot lane and I still don't feel like a pair of squishes stand a chance if the enemy has any winning lanes/jungle. I mean... if the team needs the support Morgana to ult-engage fights... I think we've lost. I'd rather have my 0/8 Leona with that job over my 4/1 Morgana any day.

I had A LOT of games this season where I was like 4/1/6 bot lane or something and I just hard lost the game because my jungle/top/mid fed their asses off.  She really isn't that good with using her lead.  

Especially since she can't protect an ADC as well as some other supports.  It's not even that Morgana will die.  Cause in truth I average very few deaths per game, less than three, but if somebody like Leblanc mid is fed then my ADC will get one hit killed through blackshield and there's nothing I can really do about it.  

So its hard for me to believe she's overpowered when frankly there's so many times when the game is just out of my hands even when I'm super far ahead and that's juts not the case with other champions.  

If you're like a 4/1/6 Velkoz support or Xerath you can solo carry the game.   It's simply not so with Morgana.
because we're picking alistar, blitz, thresh, pyke, or any other support that can easily be cock blocked by anyone with fingers and decent ping

Her root is like 10 weeks and it’s really not hard to hit AND she has a skill the blocks cc like what if u don’t do magic damage and if she hits that root you gonna die so annoying op stupid and yes I played her before and crapped on people first try but I was in low elo as I was using a different newer account also i play braum so do you have any tips on beating a morgana with braum
she shuts down my braum and if the morgana is good i cant stun the adc then morgana has the freaking stop watch its just too much

1 root= death. I played Jayce adc a while back with a morg support. everytime she stunned them it was a free kill. it's not that hard to dodge, but it will hit at least once and you'll die because of it. it's absolute cancer.

That's an interesting lane.  If you killed someone at full HP with just a Morgana root then I suspect that 90% of the damage done was Jayce.  That's hard for me to say though because I don't play against or with Jayce enough to really know what his kill pressure is like.  

I know that against most ADCs a morgana snare when someone is at full HP is not lethal unless your ADC is somebody like Draven.

Euh. I had a Support ninja a First pick Morg from me yesterday. So I went Karma mid.

Other mid friggin went Lux, missed 90% of her kit the entire lane and STILL managed to own the lane pressure. So I started roaming.

Every time I got near bot, Bam. Morgana had good vision that reached far beyond drake pit/jungle, and landed Q's. And ofc her adc was Draven.

Fun game. Hard to dodge 2 Q hit boxes.

1. A shield that shuts down all CC and requires Magic Damage to break. 
2. The 9 year root that if caught, more than likely means death
3. Nobody likes dealing with 1 or 2 if they are CC orientated supports that utilize CC to win lane. 
4. Facing Morgana mid is dull and boring... Press W, WIN LANE WOOOO <_< >_>, also the first reason.
5. Comparing shields skills and item shields that take 1 attack vs a shield that takes _**several **_ attacks to break is laughable. At least if I break any of the former shields I can go in almost immediately afterwards should the opportunity presents itself whereas I have to not only watch for Black Shield, but Q+W Combo as well. 

Last but not least..

6. I don't like her in my games, period, the end. Get over it.
Why are you so rude?  I didn't say anything rude to anyone.

I ban her for her early game potential outside, and I dont wanna deal with a bot lead.

Even more so i ban her for her black shield cause it stops all the interaction my kit has with a player (when I'm on my Galio only account)

Just a champion that is ok-strong depending on match ups but always annoying to play against.

The problem is twofold, I think: first, her popularity spiked when she got that VU, so she's probably being played by inexpert Morg players who just want to see the new stuff and hear her spam the same few lines over and over again. Second, facing Morg in mid is a totally uninteractive lane that people might want to avoid.
What does uninteractive mean?  Cause every single mage in the game power pushes.  The only difference between her and say xerath is that she is a good roamer.

> [{quoted}](name=Morgana Deus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=U7Oryyyc,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2019-04-25T19:22:04.267+0000)
>
> What does uninteractive mean?  Cause every single mage in the game power pushes.  The only difference between her and say xerath is that she is a good roamer.

I wasn't referring to her W; I was referring to her Q and E. If she's in mid and her lane opponent tries to make an aggressive play by moving toward her, they get rooted long enough for her to open a decent gap. If that opponent tries to make an aggressive play by preventing her from moving away by CCing her, she shields herself from the CC and opens a decent gap.

It's much less of a problem as support, because she can only root one of her two lane opponents, and she has to choose between shielding herself or her ally.

Oh yeah.  I often joke that the only way to lose to Morgana mid is to choose to try to dive her.  It's a very poor decision to make.  

But I'm not sure why people think that the only thing required to win lane is killing your opponent.  You can out push her and you can out roam her as quite a few champions.   

I suppose if you're determined to play something like Irelia she could be frustrating, but Idk.
